title: Request to National Archives for all documents pertaining to NASA support for 1995 film "Apollo 13"

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between NASA and the production of the 1995 film "Apollo 13," directed by Ron Howard. Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; photographs; and all records of communications between employees of the State Dept. and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "American Caravan," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Request to NASA for all 2024 TV collaborations

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all non-documentary television programs which NASA supported, or with which NASA collaborated in any way, during the year 2024. NASA has previously released to me lists of feature films and documentaries the agency supported in 2024, but they did not send me a list of television programs specifically. Lists for other years released to me by NASA include TV collaborations as a separate category.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes, and I have previously used documents released by NASA via FOIA in published research articles. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

To the Public Records Manager,

This request is made pursuant to Oregon’s Public Records Law, ORS 192.311–192.478 for the following records:

1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of March 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of March 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

I request a fee waiver under ORS 192.324(5) because disclosure primarily benefits the public by informing community understanding of surveillance-based enforcement and public impact. I am requesting these records for noncommercial purposes and intend to make the results publicly available. These records will be actively shared and used by community groups throughout Eugene. If fees will exceed $25, please provide a written cost estimate and do not proceed without confirmation.

Please provide the audit data in a structured format such as .csv, .xls, or another machine-readable database filetype. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or another electronic format if not.
Thank you in advance for your cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request.

Sincerely,
Seth May

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Disabity x Network
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

1. The total number of students who have IEPs in school years 2024/2025 to date by disability category broken down by network per disability category. (Disability x Network)

For example, if the primary disability is Autism, there should be a column with the number of students per network who have a primary disability of autism. This applies to all of the disability categories.

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani
